Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Just as a flower does not pick and choose its color, shape, or fragrance, the awakened mind is free from attachment and aversion." - Sutta Nipata

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Radiate boundless love towards the entire world." - Karaniya Metta Sutta

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think, we become." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "The root of suffering is attachment." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Pain is inevitable, but suffering is optional." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you." - Sutta Nipata

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "The mind is everything. What you think, you become." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "There is no path to happiness; happiness is the path." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Better than a thousand useless words is one useful word, hearing which one attains peace." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "The one in whom no longer exist the craving and thirst that perpetuate becoming; how could you track that Awakened one, trackless, and of limitless range?" - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Happiness does not depend on what you have or who you are. It solely relies on what you think." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "If you truly loved yourself, you could never hurt another." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "As a bee gathers nectar and moves on without harming the flower, so should a sage act in a village." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have." - Dhammapada

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Shema Yisrael Adonai Eloheinu Adonai Echad" - Deuteronomy 6:4: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is One.

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "And God said, 'Let there be light,' and there was light." - Genesis 1:3

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "You shall love your neighbor as yourself." - Leviticus 19:18

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy." - Exodus 20:8

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "You shall have no other gods before me." - Exodus 20:3

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth." - Exodus 21:24

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "You shall not steal." - Exodus 20:15

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Do not stand idly by while your neighbor's blood is shed." - Leviticus 19:16

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might." - Deuteronomy 6:5

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you? But to fear the Lord your God, to walk in all his ways, to love him, to serve the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul." - Deuteronomy 10:12

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Whoever saves a life, it is considered as if he saved an entire world." - Sanhedrin 4:5

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "The world endures only for the sake of the breath of schoolchildren." - Shabbat 119b

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Pray for the welfare of the government, for were it not for the fear it inspires, every man would swallow his neighbor alive." - Avot 3:2

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "The day is short, the work is great, the laborers are lazy, the reward is abundant, and the Master is urgent." - Avot 2:20

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "Who is wise? One who learns from every person." - Avot 4:1

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "If I am not for myself, who will be for me? And if I am only for myself, what am I? And if not now, when?" - Avot 1:14

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "In a place where there are no men, strive to be a man." - Pirkei Avot 2:6

Label: Spirituality
Stories: "The highest form of wisdom is kindness." - Sukkah 49b

Label: Spirituality
